padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1098981">tsyganovaelena1981</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-11-18">11/18/17 07:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Artemisia ... This perfume I have associated with Marian Maudsley, the main character of the movie "The go-between" 2015. Who hasn't seen-very lovely film,advise!<br />
Warm, cozy, soft powdery scent, as Kitty. But it is passion that makes man wish woman dressed in this perfume. Musk and Amber-cocktail of desires, very sensual and passionate. The scent is very stable, but encloses a gentle cloud as a scarf around the neck. I adore this perfume,one of my favourites</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="881519"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=881519#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent874270" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc874270" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mooniq"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35759"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35759.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mooniq" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Sensi-557.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.557.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sensi"title="Sensi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma874270ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd874270" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35759">Mooniq</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-25">10/25/17 22:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On me a soft, powdery, clean and flowery scent. Very alike DKNY Cashmere Mist - A very nice and safe every-day-scent. Maybe not for a teenager, bur sure for a mature woman. <br />
<br />
P mig en mjuk, pudrig, ren och blommig doft. Vldigt lik DKNY Cashmere Misgt - en trevlig och sker varje-dag-doft. Kanske inte tilltalar tonringen, men tilltalar nog mnga kvinnor mitt i livet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="874270"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=874270#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent872460" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc872460" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="geanina_gandac"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/976275"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.976275.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="geanina_gandac" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coromandel-Eau-de-Parfum-41783.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41783.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coromandel Eau de Parfum"title="Coromandel Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma872460ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd872460" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/976275">geanina_gandac</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-19">10/19/17 22:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Artemisia opens with sweet green notes mixed with fruits. It is a sweet fruity odour, not sour or pungent. It has a nice opening.<br />
After a while, I feel lily of the valley and jasmine in a green armour. Not a loud floral perfume. A skin fragrance, sweet and pleasant.<br />
The dry-down is powdery and woody and is all about musk.<br />
Artemisia is a nice fragrance. It has good longevity and intimate sillage. This is a discreet scent, good for a quiet day when you want something to make you feel comfortable.<br />
Give it a try if you like florals with pleasant smell and a good vibe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="872460"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=872460#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent850895" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc850895" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="adice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.885210.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="adice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Histoires-de-Parfums/1804-4486.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4486.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1804"title="1804"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma850895ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd850895" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885210">adice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-08-13">08/13/17 20:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soft, clean, powdery, floral vanilla musk. A scent to pair with a cozy short sleeved cream colored cashmere sweater, pearl earrings, and a retro matte red lipstick. Super inoffensive great for daytime or office wear. Reminds me of others in the same genre but is closest in my collection I think to Royal Muska but also similar to others I've tried like Serge Lutens Clair de Musc and SJP Lovely. I always think these types of perfumes are a "hug from mom" or "good girl" scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="850895"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=850895#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent843684" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc843684" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="littledragon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2218"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="littledragon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma843684ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd843684" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2218">littledragon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-22">07/22/17 00:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This makes me feel like I'm very clean, wearing a clean, completely white, comfortable suit, with white shoes, sitting on a yacht, relaxing, and enjoying the evening breeze that brings with it a soft, sweet scent of white flowers from afar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="843684"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=843684#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent842610" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc842610" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Flowerwood"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004628"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1004628.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Flowerwood" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma842610ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd842610" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004628">Flowerwood</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-18">07/18/17 23:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Warm, soft musk supported by florals and a very discrete vanilla. Artemisia is very well balanced and I could not really identify the main floral as violet until I read the notes pyramid.<br />
The dry down is very skin close, it feels like it is just amplifying and embellishing the best of your personal skin scent.<br />
Artemisia has to be tested on skin. At least for me it is very different on paper, with a sharp edge not present when applied on skin. On paper much of the warm musky feel is also missing.<br />
 <br />
 The fragrance is very silent but creates a warm and friendly atmosphere. Being embedded in the gentle warm atmosphere of Artemisia makes life a bit smoother and brighter.  What I could wish for is some more sillage, at present it is a very private scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="842610"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=842610#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent817352" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc817352" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarah_0508"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1061908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarah_0508" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Solaris-81413.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81413.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Solaris"title="Solaris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma817352ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd817352" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1061908">sarah_0508</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-28">04/28/17 05:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted to like it but, to me, there was nothing redeeming about this perfume. The reviewer who said this smelt like latex was spot on. I feel like I'm sat in the dentist's chair when I'm wearing this.<br />
<br />
Whilst the latex smell did settle on the drydown it was still unmistakably there and ruined the whole composition for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="817352"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=817352#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent815592" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc815592" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MadLynne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/839653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MadLynne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Givenchy-Harvest-2010-Amarige-Ylang-Ylang-11709.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11709.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Givenchy Harvest 2010 Amarige Ylang Ylang"title="Givenchy Harvest 2010 Amarige Ylang Ylang"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma815592ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd815592" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); Both fragrances are very similar almost identical, PA seams to be a bit sweeter but lovely anyway. Strange to see a modern designer fragrance in this Victorian packaging.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="815592"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=815592#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent815438" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; DKNY Cashmere Mist EDP smells very similar, but much better, and much less $. Make sure you get the EDP</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="815438"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=815438#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent814512" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc814512" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MeThePerson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/752819"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.752819.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MeThePerson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/Amour-Nocturne-18755.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18755.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amour Nocturne"title="Amour Nocturne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma814512ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd814512" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/752819">MeThePerson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-20">04/20/17 11:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Woah, definitely get the reference to burnt rubber some people are mentioning! I think this is more due a sourness, especially in the opening which was incredibly bitter. I put this down to the green apple/violet combination (possibly affected by the oak moss in some small part?). Underneath, the powder and soft vanilla is clearly the slow starter that begins to overtake and lead from the front. With my 'oriental friendly' skin I get the drydown as a baking apple cooked in milk with brown sugar and vanilla pods melted in the centre made occasionally by my grandmother at the harvesting of their apple tree bounty. Mouthwatering and crisp but still velvety and subtle. So far this is a contender for my summer go to. Not heavy enough to be overly cloying and oddly refreshing, almost cooling?<br />
Update with longevity to come.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="814512"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=814512#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent808672" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc808672" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sonichka#2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1055358"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1055358.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sonichka#2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma808672ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd808672" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1055358">Sonichka#2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-02">04/02/17 22:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am ambivalent about this one...<br />
I got it because I couldn't understand it. <br />
This is like a unicorn to me.<br />
I loved the softness and mystery of Artemisia.<br />
Strangely it ends up smelling a little too loud on me!<br />
I smell creamy vanilla and lots of musk.<br />
In fact, it smells like caramel on me.<br />
I enjoy the light herbal top notes more, but it always ends up too powdery and gourmand for my taste.<br />
I kind of like it anyway!<br />
<br />
I have a roll-on almost unused for swap if anyone is interested. : )</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="808672"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=808672#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent808046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc808046" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="circlecrew"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/168076"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="circlecrew" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Infusion-d-Iris-Eau-de-Parfum-Absolue-14227.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14227.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Infusion d'Iris Eau de Parfum Absolue"title="Infusion d'Iris Eau de Parfum Absolue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma808046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd808046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/168076">circlecrew</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-31">03/31/17 21:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really wanted to love this--not to be. I sit here nursing a headache after 2 small spritzs from the sample I received. I can see how there are so many who find it similar to DK Cashmere Mist, but on me there is a thick underlying smell of burnt rubber! Yuck! This perfume has smelled the same for 2 hrs. No change of notes whatsoever.  I will stick with the DK Cashmere Mist. A much more beautiful, elegant scent for the $. I highly recommend spending $5 on a sample of this. SO happy I didnt spend the money--and this is not cheap--on a blind buy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="808046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=808046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent801959" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Violets are not usually my thing,they usually give me an impression of scented earasers I used to use as a schoolgirl and no exception here.but in the best way possible.vanilla,clean musk,some fruity notes and light white florals(there's more jasmine to my nose than lily of the valley)and sandalwood blend with violet to create a soft,clean and lovely scent.musky vanilla becomes stronger in drydown and makes me like it less<br />

</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="801959"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=801959#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent779132" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc779120" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="abra_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1027122"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1027122.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="abra_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma779120ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd779120" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1027122">abra_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-01-08">01/08/17 19:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought a sample. It opens with violet and powder - dries down to violet soap. Old-fashioned. Not my type.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="779120"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=779120#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent758672" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc758672" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="honeybaby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/9749"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.9749.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="honeybaby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma758672ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd758672" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/9749">honeybaby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-05">11/05/16 22:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My husband wore this for a year! We got it for him while on vacation in Miami. We both loved it! Only recently found out that it is "for women." I don't think he was embarrassed by that or anything (I wear Cartier Declaration, Hermes Voyage and have worn Vetiver by Guerlain and he loves these "men's" fragrances on me) -- but I don't think he will wear it again. Maybe I will!? There is something so warm and nutty about it. I really like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="758672"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=758672#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent752089" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc752089" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gigi The Fashionista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/951288"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.951288.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gigi The Fashionista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragonard/Violette-14299.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14299.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Violette"title="Violette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma752089ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd752089" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/951288">Gigi The Fashionista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-15">10/15/16 02:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fragrance Review For Artemisia<br />
<br />
Penhaligon<br />
<br />
Top Notes<br />
<br />
Nectarine Green Notes<br />
<br />
Middle Notes<br />
<br />
Green Apple Lily of the Valley Jasmine Tea Violet Vanilla <br />
<br />
Base Notes<br />
<br />
Oak Moss Sandalwood Amber Musk <br />
<br />
Artemisia! <br />
<br />
This fragrance seduced me with it's greenness which I mistook for actual artemisia. There is no artemisia note but they can fool anyone into thinking it's on here. The green notes in the first spritz are shrubs and sage bush, medicinal plants that smell just like walking into an herbal shop with that unmistakable green medicinal plant smell. Lovely. A summer time scent, it features sweet edible fruit including nectarine and green apple. They are both detectable and quite sweet, not at all like fruit shampoo but definitely like fruit out in the open air, sweet and projecting their scent to any nearby nose. <br />
<br />
The floral notes in this fragrance are ravishing. Only three: jasmine, violet and lily of the valley. The lily of the valley, green and white floral notes combined, are at the forefront. This is a pastoral scent, like being in nature, in the forest with only the natural scents of flowers and woods. The violet is quite nice and I wish it was a bit stronger. It turns powdery as does the jasmine. Sweet powdery florals. There is a little bit of tea but it's part of that green note arrangement. The tea is not as noticeable as the flowers. To me this is earthy, aromatic, green and floral. It's also fresh and sweet.<br />
<br />
The dry down is a musk which can be both spicy and musky. It had a strange resemblance to perfumes like Victoria Secret Heavenly Angels (floral musk) and Bath &amp; Body Works Moonlight Path (floral musk) but it has much more going on because it is more full bodied and rich. Penhaligon would never really smell like either B&amp;B Works or VS but it's a bit of the same type of musk dry down. The amber is absolutely gorgeous, resinous and warm, melted like actual amber from a tree. A woody note emerges and it's a sandalwood. There is also moss of oak and the whole thing feels like losing oneself in woods and getting your hair and limbs entangled in woods and moss and artemisia shrubs. <br />
<br />
When I was little I remember the few shrubs and plants that grew wildly in cemented neighborhoods and parks, smelled like this scent. I don't know if it was artemisia at the time but it was. It's sharp, pungent, and it lasts and lasts and lasts. The scent is on you all day. I remember I had to take a shower to get ride of that artemisia smell. This is the more beautiful and perfumy verison of what I experienced as a child. I always wanted to smell it again and now I have. <br />
<br />
Stunning and suitable to summer and spring. However as it dries down, it's warm and spicy-musky and amber, so it's also very lovely as a winter perfume. This is an all season scent: winter, autumn spring and summer. It's like they put all the seasons into one fragrance. Fruit for summer, florals for spring, and artemisia/tea/oak moss, sandalwood, musk and amber for winter and fall. You can wear this any time anywhere. Don't over spray as it's quite potent. A little at a time and it turns into a pretty powder.<br />
<br />
Beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="752089"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=752089#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent748322" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc748322" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="racka64"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/204413"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.204413.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="racka64" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma748322ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd748322" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/204413">racka64</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-02">10/02/16 06:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soft, cuddly, mildly sweet, very feminine imho. You can never go overboard with it, it mainly stays close to the skin. If you want it to be noticeable to your surroundings, than you have to use it liberally, in which case it becomes a compliment magnet from either male or female acquaintances. All season gem :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="748322"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=748322#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent734591" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc734591" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Soofiya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/982196"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.982196.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Soofiya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Valentino-Donna-31411.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31411.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valentino Donna"title="Valentino Donna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma734591ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd734591" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/982196">Soofiya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-20">08/20/16 21:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can only detect a very soft,powdery musk,delicately sweet violet and smooth,not very sweet or too warm vanilla and a hint of fruity smell,maybe nectarin but not a juicy one..I love all the notes mentioned here,which I don't detect.tea,green apple,other florals but no problem..I really looove this soft powdered scent..it''s very delicate,fragile and amazingly clean..actually this is the cleanest scent I've ever smelt,I don't know why I find it this much clean,it reminds me something very familiar which I'm not able to recall now..maybe smell of a body lotion or a body powder or a cleaning product or something like this..it's summery,fresh,girly and lovely..I really do loooveee the initial phase,there are not dramatic changes in notes,I just feel the overall scent gets a bit warm and a dominant sandalwood sits on the front seat,this little change makes it less pretty to my nose,I just wished that cool clean musky violet and fruity icecreamy vanilla lasted forever..however I don't dislike the drydown<br />
longevity is moderate on my skin and sillage is almost soft.I'm thinking hardly to remember what was that familiar smell,identical to opening part<br />
</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="734591"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=734591#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent734503" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc734503" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma734503ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd734503" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-20">08/20/16 14:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance was one that I often smelt on paper and could never understand as to why it was so popular. I could not smell ANYTHING.<br />
Gradually I familiarized myself with the scent. Someone had remarked previously that it is best to think of a strawberry dusted in icing sugar. Its now a fragrance I enjoy wearing for personal preference. It definitely comes across as feminine. I love the soft, un-offending musk of the scent.<br />
Everything within this scent is very soft. It smells great on a nice summers day. I once however smelt it in the hot Indian weather and did not enjoy the scent at all. In hot weather the notes smell to sweet. This is a subtle scent and is not well suited blasting out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="734503"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=734503#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent727800" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc727800" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MissGabrielleO"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005947"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1005947.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MissGabrielleO" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3865.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"title="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma727800ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd727800" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005947">MissGabrielleO</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-07-29">07/29/16 06:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is not a review so much as an observation. I had wanted this for a long time and finally ordered a gift set of Penhaligon's miniatures which included Artemesia.  Being a fan of the Italian renaissance painter Artemesia Gentileschi, I thought that this could be my perfect signature perfume.<br />
<br />
It is not a bad perfume, however it smells EXACTLY like the apartment and person of a woman named Selma who lived in our vacation condo building in Atlantic City in the late 80s/early 90s Selma was probably in her 70s, wore spangly sweaters, smoked, had curled and set dyed hair, and always wore lots of gold jewellery. She was kind of a more refined Grandma Yetta!<br />
<br />
This is a lovely perfume, but I cannot actually wear it without being instantly transported there and it is so vivid that I can almost taste the little foil wrapped fruit candies she had in bowls on the table. I am now trying to figure out what she could have been wearing - I wonder if, given the notes, she doused herself in Shalimar? Either way, once I realized the connection, I've had fun spritzing this on at home on a weekend and being taken back 25 years to old New Jersey!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="727800"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=727800#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent718964" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc718964" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="paneradfisk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/295503"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.295503.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="paneradfisk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/La-Petite-Robe-Noire-14681.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14681.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Petite Robe Noire"title="La Petite Robe Noire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma718964ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd718964" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/295503">paneradfisk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-29">06/29/16 07:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A <b>soft, powdery, slightly sweet and delicate scent</b>, inoffensive yet not boring at all. Pale and translucent yet memorable, cozy and comforting. The violets are well desguised, and marry very well with the rest of the notes. Don't judge it from the nozzle or the first spray, the drydown is the magic. A lower priced alternative is the perfume oil Madam X by Alkemia, which has more violets, but the same soft powder and sweetness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="718964"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=718964#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent713910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc713910" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Victoria88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1006552"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1006552.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Victoria88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma713910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd713910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1006552">Victoria88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-10">06/10/16 23:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This did not agree with me. I would describe this fragrance as smothering, muggy and warm. There's something about it that makes me feel carsick, nauseous. All I can smell is the vanilla, musk, amber, and sandalwood. It reminds me of Obsession by Calvin Klein.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="713910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=713910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent710422" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc710422" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="StarfireK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/203623"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="StarfireK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juicy-Couture/Viva-la-Juicy-Gold-Couture-25753.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25753.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Viva la Juicy Gold Couture"title="Viva la Juicy Gold Couture"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma710422ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd710422" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/203623">StarfireK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-30">05/30/16 11:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet, haunting and fragile. Not a fragrance for conquering towns or hearts. More of a shy, retiring violet. Pretty and mild.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="710422"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=710422#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent697414" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc697414" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="UndergroundBlossom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/912052"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.912052.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="UndergroundBlossom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-Eau-de-Parfum-40069.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40069.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 Eau de Parfum"title="Chanel No 5 Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma697414ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd697414" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/912052">UndergroundBlossom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-17">04/17/16 15:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On me this smells dry and almost like a faint trail of second hand smoke. I think Its the violet. Like many other reviewers have said, its very tame. Good for business meetings or a school PTA potluck. It is not daring nor is it a risk taker. I bought this fragrance in a set from Penhaligons, I do not think I will purchase it separately.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="697414"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=697414#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent687020" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc687020" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hippo Princess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/993703"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.993703.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hippo Princess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Death-and-Decay-26630.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26630.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Death and Decay"title="Death and Decay"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma687020ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd687020" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/993703">Hippo Princess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-03-14">03/14/16 23:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I fell in love with Artemisia at the Penhaligon boutique and the scent stayed on my mind (one might even say I was obsessed with it) until I finally got a bottle of my own weeks later. <br />
<br />
This fragrance is simply dreamy. It is supremely comforting, and something about it reminds me of some fond memory I can't quite place. This is the scent of how bunnies feel, or how cream-colored Chantilly lace looks. <br />
<br />
The fragrance is soft, little more than a whisper. The opening is sugared nectarine or peach pie a la mode, buttery-crusted and warm from the oven. This gives way to notes of creamy vanilla and powdery violet. Artemisia feels drinkable, like gently-spiced milky tea served from bone china. <br />
<br />
I wear this to bed when I need to dream of being a princess.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="687020"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=687020#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent674337" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc674337" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nikoleta1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/408429"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.408429.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nikoleta1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Fleurissimo-4250.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4250.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleurissimo"title="Fleurissimo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma674337ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd674337" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/408429">nikoleta1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-02-04">02/04/16 12:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soft, nice, close to skin, safe pick.<br />
Good for a bed time or hot weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="674337"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=674337#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent667044" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc667044" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mellyhelly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10773"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10773.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mellyhelly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Samsara-Eau-de-Parfum-55.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Samsara Eau de Parfum"title="Samsara Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma667044ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd667044" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10773">Mellyhelly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-14">01/14/16 06:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm happy I'm not alone together with nail polish remover!<br />
I tested this one yesterday. I like these bottles and Penhaligon's usually have that distinct old times aristocratic style, but bottles are not the most important thing. As soon as it hit the paper it reaked of nail polish or nail polish remover, not the aggressive acetone type rather the one flavoured with synthetic almond. I expected to see almond, at least, if not Ethyl Acetate ;-P<br />
On my skin it gave out the same first impression then in a few minutes it mellowed down to an almondy, creamy, musky...nothingness. Not bad, apart from scary initial burst, but very faint and close to the skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="667044"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=667044#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent665908" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc665908" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="noshant"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/953948"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.953948.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="noshant" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Samsara-Eau-de-Toilette-67534.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67534.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Samsara Eau de Toilette"title="Samsara Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma665908ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd665908" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/953948">noshant</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-10">01/10/16 14:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh dear. On my skin, it smells like nail polish remover to begin with. The alcoholic and acetone-like bitterness slowly dies down a bit over time, but it lingers alongside the violet, vanilla and musk, resulting in a powdery, bittersweet drydown. The remover smell finally disappears after about an hour and a half, but that 90 minute period of smelling like fragranced nail polish remover just isn't worth it. <br />
I was originally very excited to test this out, as the notes appealed to me as did the name. Unfortunately it just doesn't work on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="665908"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=665908#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent658386" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc658386" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TJthe4th"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/979012"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.979012.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TJthe4th" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nina-Ricci/L-Air-du-Temps-1014.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1014.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Air du Temps"title="L'Air du Temps"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma658386ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd658386" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/979012">TJthe4th</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-18">12/18/15 14:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree with those who say that it smells just like Cashmre Mist.  The big difference is that CM smells terrible on my skin, and this is truly delightful.  A little powdery, a little sweet floral musk.
