You can teach Sunday school in this and wear it with your cashmere and pearls.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="658386"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=658386#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent656844" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc656844" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RubyBirdy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/954069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="RubyBirdy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Loves/White-Rose-Lemon-Leaves-37576.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37576.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Rose & Lemon Leaves"title="White Rose & Lemon Leaves"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma656844ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd656844" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/954069">RubyBirdy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-14">12/14/15 10:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soft and bright floral musk with the slightest edge of violet and a creamy vanilla. Exquisitely refined, with the downside that it is a bit boring. Like all Penhaligon's fragrances for women, this is extremely understated and appropriate for the office. Every woman should probably have one of these demure, understated fragrances in her wardrobe, because there's always an occasion for a gentle and unchallenging floral. But just one. It's a "nice" scent, but there is only one way to be nice - there are many ways to be interesting, and Artemisia unfortunately has none of them. I like my sample but I would not spend $60 on this, let alone over $100.<br />
<br />
My criticisms are the same as for every perfume by this house: it's so quiet that it is essentially mute, and it wears so close to the skin that I ought to start charging it rent. When you get so little projection that you forget you're wearing the fragrance even when it's slathered all over your neck, you have to start to wonder why you're paying such a high price for the product. Penhaligon's can surely afford not to skimp on the raw materials...<br />
<br />
With regard to Artemisia Gentileschi, this Judith did not behead Holofernes. She did his laundry.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="656844"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=656844#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent653465" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc653465" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jadetrail51"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36890"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.36890.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jadetrail51" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma653465ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd653465" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36890">jadetrail51</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-03">12/03/15 06:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wear this often without too much thought as it is safe and appropriate to wear anytime.  The Vanilla is warm and comfortable without being too sweet; The Tea makes it fresh and clean, and somewhat proper, and the Musk is subtle making it innocently sexy. Both my spouse and kids love this one on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="653465"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=653465#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent653451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc653451" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="magda14012"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18424"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="magda14012" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coco-Noir-15963.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15963.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coco Noir"title="Coco Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma653451ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd653451" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18424">magda14012</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-03">12/03/15 05:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Artemisia is one of those delicate soothing scents I use at night. I love its calming effect it has on me. Its subtlety, powdery whispers, softness. It is a perfume which allows you to forget about you hectic day, unwind and relax.  Enter Artemisia spa!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="653451"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=653451#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent652226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc652226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sjam3295"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/233645"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.233645.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sjam3295" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marella-Ferrera/Marella-Ferrera-9261.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9261.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Marella Ferrera"title="Marella Ferrera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma652226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd652226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/233645">sjam3295</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-11-29">11/29/15 00:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Artemisia is a scent that I tried a long time ago, when I was just entering the world of fragrance; I dismissed it as nice but nothing special.<br />
<br />
Recently, I tried it again, and discovered a subtle beauty in it I had previously missed. This is a lovely musky, herby, faintly floral scent. To my nose, it's more like an aromatic fougere than an oriental. I can definitely smell the tea, the oak-moss and the apple as well as the musk and florals. It makes for a scent that is somehow really fresh and comforting at the same time. I think it's growing into a love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="652226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=652226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent642642" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc642642" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LeonieB"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/891081"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LeonieB" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Iris-Rebelle-48137.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48137.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Rebelle"title="Iris Rebelle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma642642ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd642642" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/891081">LeonieB</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-10-27">10/27/15 10:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like to think of myself as a bit of a "nose" but on an off day, I reach for something powdery, and Artemisia is always the one. Got a lovely selection of niche samples lately which included Amouage Lyric which struck me as a rosed-up Artemisia.  Used to have a bit of a snooty problem with Penhaligon's, don't know why, they have some great and unique scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="642642"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=642642#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent613946" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc613946" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="StellaDiverFlynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/475352"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.475352.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="StellaDiverFlynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dame-Perfumery/Chocolate-Perfume-Oil-43159.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43159.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chocolate Perfume Oil"title="Chocolate Perfume Oil"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma613946ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd613946" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/475352">StellaDiverFlynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-21">07/21/15 08:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening of Penhaligon's Artemisia on me seems to have a strong presence of alcohol, but it unfolds beautifully once calmed down. The gently spiced violet peeks through during the first hour. The fragrance then settles down into a velvety vanilla and musk with a rounded woody undertone, which shares some similarities with the red bean paste effect in Kenzo Madly, but warmer, smoother and more approachable.<br />
<br />
The sillage is moderate to soft and the longevity is around 8 hours. Artemisia is quite abstract in nature. It feels like applying a nourishing cream on the skin, clean and comforting, yet so different from the conventional 'clean' 'fresh' type of fragrances. I'd definitely recommend it as a versatile yet unusual skin scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="613946"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=613946#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent611697" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc611697" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Paintedlily"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/190437"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.190437.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Paintedlily" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sarah-Jessica-Parker/Covet-1404.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1404.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Covet"title="Covet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma611697ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd611697" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/190437">Paintedlily</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-12">07/12/15 12:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Artemisia is powdery, lightly floral, woody and clean. All qualities feel like they have a warmth to them as well. It teeters between natural and man-made (the word "synthetic" suggests a sharpness and this doesn't have that, it's very soft).<br />
<br />
This gives me two distinct impressions: <br />
1. Going for a nature walk on a warm, yet slightly humid Spring day. <br />
2. A woman that has recently stepped out of the shower, applied body powder and is now styling her hair.<br />
It could read either way to me, although I'd say it leans a little more to 2 because of the quality that reads "clean" (musk). <br />
<br />
Sillage is soft, at less than arms length (this was applied from a dauber and not a spray) and longevity is about 4-6 hours on dry skin in a dry climate. Good for Spring or Fall daytime wear.<br />
<br />
Very pretty fragrance with a soft spoken beauty. Will certainly be appreciated by admirers of subtlety.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="611697"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=611697#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent604610" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc604610" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tarin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/920497"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.920497.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tarin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cacharel/Noa-242.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.242.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Noa"title="Noa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma604610ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd604610" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/920497">Tarin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-16">06/16/15 21:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was looking for something ghostly and ethereal if that makes sense, which is why I tried this because it was recommended to me and even has been referred to as a haunting fragrance. It was nearly perfect, it smelt to me like being in a graveyard overgrown with moss and white flowers, it even has some smokiness about it but is still very feminine, I nearly went back and purchased a whole bottle of it but something just wasn't quite right to me, it reminded me of something that I didn't like but couldn't quite put my finger on, maybe the fragrance Gingham by Innoxa that I can't stand, which is a green, baby powder type perfume, or the muskiness in the dry down was just too sickly and overpowering, it's a shame because I thought I had found the perfect scent I was looking for but I guess not.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="604610"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=604610#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent604146" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc604146" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="racb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.927134.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="racb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Black-Orchid-Eau-de-Toilette-31969.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31969.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"title="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma604146ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd604146" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134">racb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-15">06/15/15 10:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this - soft, fresh, floral but not sweet. It has a musky undertone which gives it a bit of gravitas.<br />
It lasted a long time on my skin and settled down to a warm powdery, musky pleasantness.<br />
<br />
Very nice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="604146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=604146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent582095" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc582095" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fire2heart"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10788"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10788.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="fire2heart" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elixir-5673.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5673.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elixir"title="Elixir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma582095ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd582095" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10788">fire2heart</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-04-01">04/01/15 20:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This just arrived in the mail. Another blind buy.... I really need to stop doing that with scents that are at this price point. But, I found a decent price and took the plunge.<br />
<br />
It is a very delicate smelling scent. It starts out smelling a bit musky and I can detect nectarines in it. There is a sharp note in it and I don't know if it's the green notes, the tea note or the lily of the valley. I can't smell it when my nose is up close but I can in the air around me. It then turns a bit soapy and it is powdery when I put my nose up to my skin. As I type this out, it has now turned to a skin scent of soapy powder and musk.<br />
<br />
I'll have to revisit this when it gets warmer outside. I bought this for the summer months and it is cold and stormy outside at the moment.<br />
<br />
So far, it's ok.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="582095"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=582095#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent560980" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc560980" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="feezee10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884408"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="feezee10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma560980ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd560980" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884408">feezee10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-22">01/22/15 02:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i love this smell when it is spray on the paper,soft and sexy scent.<br />
<br />
on my skin, after few minutes it goes to powdery scent. i wish i can get the same smell as on the paper :( <br />
<br />
nevertheless it is long lasting fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="560980"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=560980#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent555762" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc555762" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JuniperMimi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/870343"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.870343.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="JuniperMimi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elizabeth-and-James/Nirvana-Black-21984.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21984.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nirvana Black"title="Nirvana Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma555762ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd555762" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/870343">JuniperMimi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-05">01/05/15 22:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very feminine. There's definitely a 'clean laundry' smell at the beginning. It's soft and powdery with some violet and there's something slightly spicy in there but it's not bold enough to work out what it is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="555762"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=555762#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent555665" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc555665" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ruffienne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821453"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.821453.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ruffienne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma555665ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd555665" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821453">Ruffienne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-05">01/05/15 16:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a sweet, mild, elegant musk on my skin.<br />
<br />
Expressively feminine yet tastefully restrained, this is just a tiny bit too generic for my taste.  I don't think I'll be buying a FB, but I can see why others would. :-)<br />
<br />
It grows on you though - be sure to give it a few minutes (or even a few wearings) to be sure you understand it completely. The opening, which is brisk and a little bit unbalanced, is not representative of the scent as a whole.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="555665"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=555665#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent516764" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc516764" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="akhala"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820245"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.820245.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="akhala" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma516764ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd516764" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820245">akhala</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-25">08/25/14 00:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is very elegant. I associate it with something a woman making a name into "a mens' world" would wear. And after all it was made in honor of Artemisia Gentileschi, the controversial and celebrated painter of the Renaissance. Long neglected as a serious artist, her work was often attributed to other male artists. Reclaimed as a feminist icon in recent years, she is now rightly seen as a serious and groundbreaking artist. She also spent some time in England at the court of King Charles I. Her most famous work is the chiaroscuro masterpiece Judith Beheading Holfernes. <br />
<br />
It has nothing to do with the ancient queen Artemisia, the plant nor the deity Artemis like many think and are left disappointed. <br />
<br />
For me the scent starts of with nectarines, apples and green foliage. After some time  the flowers and vanilla kick-in. Beautiful flowers and wrapped up in sunshine and butterflies. The end is warm, powdery and earthy - mainly musk and oak moss with the rest of ingredients lingering somewhere there as to remind of themselves. <br />
<br />
I wouldn't describe the scent as fresh at all. On me it has a lot of presence and warmth and this is making it more suitable for the fall/winter season, or perhaps a cold summer evening.<br />
<br />
And the bottle just got me - very beautiful! Artemisia is truly unique but yet comfortable scent!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="516764"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=516764#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent511219" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc511219" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fioletowy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/808129"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fioletowy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/24-Faubourg-27.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="24 Faubourg"title="24 Faubourg"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma511219ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd511219" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/808129">Fioletowy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-06">08/06/14 20:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful floral scent that's not too sweet even with the lovely violety powdery dry down. It feels very grand and old fashioned to me but I like that so no complaints.<br />
However, on me it's so strong and lasts forever, so much so that for the first couple of hours the smell is so powerful, it's like being hit over the head with a copper bottomed saucepan. Subtle it is not, not on me. So I have to be careful where I wear it. At home on my own, fine. In a lift, no.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="511219"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=511219#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent508979" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc508979" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="becuille"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/768337"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.768337.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="becuille" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vero-Profumo/Kiki-Eau-de-Parfum-10117.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10117.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kiki Eau de Parfum"title="Kiki Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma508979ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd508979" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/768337">becuille</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-30">07/30/14 06:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a pretty scent for women who don't do cutesy. It's so soft and giggly, but never gets sweet, sickly or overtly fruity like so many other frags that aim for "pretty" tend to. It's like a gentle tickle. <br />
<br />
Penhaligons really have blending down pat (except for Bluebell). It's nigh on impossible to pick out distinct notes in most of their fragrances and this one is no different. You get a hint of the violet throughout, but it only serves to soften the scent, it never overwhelms. I'm very impressed with this house's use of violet in both this and Ellenisia. They seem to really understand where violet is at its most useful within a fragrance. <br />
<br />
This is predominately powdery and musky. It's very soft, with minimal sillage. About an hour in, I thought it was veering towards soapy, which is something I really dislike, but it snapped out of it and stayed flirty and pretty - but in a very elegant way. <br />
<br />
Pared down, grown up pretty. I love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="508979"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=508979#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent500616" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc500616" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="starlakid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/806736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.806736.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="starlakid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Juniper-Sling-13266.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13266.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Juniper Sling"title="Juniper Sling"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma500616ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd500616" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/806736">starlakid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-01">07/01/14 04:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was delighted this morning to receive my full bottle of Artemisia. As a newcomer to the world of fragrance appreciation I shall leave describing it to someone with more experience. What I will share is that it makes me feel as though I have walked out of an E.M. Forster novel or that I'm Julia from Brideshead Revisited. I couldn't help but put on my favourite dress today and the heels I wouldn't ordinarily wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="500616"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=500616#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent499059" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc499059" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="missgeschick"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20016"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.20016.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="missgeschick" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Armani-Code-Satin-31664.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31664.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Armani Code Satin"title="Armani Code Satin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma499059ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd499059" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20016">missgeschick</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-06-25">06/25/14 12:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an intimate scent. The first spray is kind of musty, it evolves into a nice powdery vanilla-musk with a hint of violet and peach later. Soft, warm, close to skin, feminine... but no sweetness there for me. <br />
I guess I have to try this several times yet to decide if buy it or not.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="499059"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=499059#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent496628" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc496628" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="etude83"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/533340"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="etude83" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma496628ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd496628" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/533340">etude83</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-06-17">06/17/14 11:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>(And Penhaligon's is one of the dwindlingly few lines that SA's at the high end department stores won't give you bitch-face for lurking around the testers for an exorbitant length of time.  *cough* GUERLAIN *cough* What is WITH that?)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="496628"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=496628#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent496627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc496627" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="etude83"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/533340"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="etude83" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma496627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd496627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/533340">etude83</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-06-17">06/17/14 11:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree that there is a sweet, soapy inoffensiveness to this one that is actually surprisingly charming.  There is baby powder -- but not a la "Love's Baby Soft."  In other words, the sweet talcum aura it invokes is complemented by some depth and even a bit of dissonance.  (I feel the same way about the "baby powder" of KM's Loukhoum.)  I don't really get the fruit notes listed, but I do get the violet and vanilla.  And I swear I smell some sweet myrrh in this -- to the point that I'm reminded of Profumum's Vanitas if somebody swapped in stevia for the sugar.<br />
<br />
If you love sweet orientals but can't quite stomach gourmands, this may be right up your alley.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="496627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=496627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent495327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc495327" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dkny27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/62569"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.62569.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dkny27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Nuit-Tresor-29157.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29157.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Nuit Trsor"title="La Nuit Trsor"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma495327ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd495327" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/62569">dkny27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-06-13">06/13/14 14:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very soft, very innocent, demure, sweet...  Almost like a soft green, lightly sweetened baby powder.<br />
This is a very pretty scent, dare I say<br />
 "school-girl-esque"? <br />
I get a mild soapy violet/vanilla/peach combo with the drydown of a very calm woody tea.. Ever so vague if you don't know what to look for....<br />
Very sad that the longevity on me was only about an hour....</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="495327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=495327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent488115" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc488115" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MirageMirage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43945"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.43945.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MirageMirage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Very-Valentino-Eau-Toilette-56436.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56436.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Very Valentino Eau Toilette"title="Very Valentino Eau Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma488115ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd488115" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43945">MirageMirage</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-22">05/22/14 10:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>GORGEOUS!...and addictive ;)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="488115"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=488115#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent486338" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc486338" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alchemist1976stephanie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/95986"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.95986.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alchemist1976stephanie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tokyo-Milk-Parfumerie-Curiosite/Tainted-Love-13161.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13161.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tainted Love"title="Tainted Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma486338ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd486338" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/95986">alchemist1976stephanie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-16">05/16/14 19:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very girly musk. Opens with a floral/vanilla blend that kind of reminds me of the smell of bananas. The musk is also present right from the beginning and lingers in a billowy haze of sweetness. I wish I got more of the lily of the valley and violet than I get of the fruity notes.  Longevity is good- about 6 hours. Stays close to the body. Love the bottle too!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="486338"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=486338#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent457435" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc457435" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iamaround"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/723626"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.723626.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iamaround" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Black-Opium-25324.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25324.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Opium"title="Black Opium"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma457435ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd457435" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/723626">iamaround</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-02-15">02/15/14 13:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me this is such a cozy sandalwood musk vanilla scent.. these are the notes I get the most. Artemisia is so easy to wear, it's a cozy comfort skin-close scent, and yet very  lady like and sensual.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="457435"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=457435#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent457274" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc457274" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CeciliaKu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/214444"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.214444.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CeciliaKu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma457274ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd457274" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/214444">CeciliaKu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-02-15">02/15/14 01:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Artemisia is a scent that you could wear all year round. It is soft, feminine and clean. As inoffensive as it may appear to be, that's not to say that you won't stand out in a crowd.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="457274"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=457274#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent437977" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc437977" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hsd1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/710518"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hsd1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12192.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Neroli Portofino"title="Neroli Portofino"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma437977ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd437977" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/710518">hsd1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-20">12/20/13 15:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reminds me so much of Donna Karen Cashmere Mist.  After all these years, I remember this smell.<br />
<br />
Yesterday I loved it, however today it is being bumped down a notch to 'like', as I sadly suspect this might be what is giving me a headache:(  I remember when DK first came out, initially I also loved it's soft coziness, but that had the same effect, so I gave it away.<br />
    <br />
I have had this on for 12 hours and it is still going strong on my skin, but wish it would wear off since I have a headache.  It is soft, sweet and powdery, with vanilla and a bit of musk on me.  Soft, like something a ballerina might wear in the winter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4547"comment_id="437977"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html?ccid=437977#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent429183" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc429183" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Donna Anna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/695996"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.695996.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Donna Anna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/L-Eau-d-Hiver-2797.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2797.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau d'Hiver"title="L'Eau d'Hiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma429183ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd429183" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/695996">Donna Anna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-23">11/23/13 15:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful, feminine and extremely gentle fragrance. It literally caresses your skin.  It is also sweet and the scent of vanilla is very pronounced. When I tested this scent for the first time in the beginning the opening truly shocked me. It is a messy hodge podge really! Some sharp fruity smells mixed with something almond like and very intense smell of alcohol. It is pungent and not very attractive. But luckily it quiets down immediately and morphs into this beautiful luxurious vanilla scent. Something almond-like lingers on which is also nice and warm and comforting. I also can smell the violet after the dry-down. And soon the musk also kicks in and it is all comfort and coziness and tranquility after that. <br />
<br />
The problem? Not much development takes place after that point. And the scent is just so mellow and subdued since there is no contrast between the notes. Now the first time that I tried it I just fell in love with it. I kept sniffing it and drew comfort from it. It was absolutely great. So I bought a full bottle. And I sprayed it again the next day... and it was nice, and the third day... well, I was already bored with it and couldn't even notice it much and when I even noticed it I wasn't drawing the same kind of pleasure from it as in the first day. Soon I was craving something really fresh and pungent!<br />
<br />
You see? Such one dimensional fragrances are subject to the law of diminishing returns. Like eating a box of luxurious chocolate truffles. The first one is heaven in a bite. The second one is just lovely, the third one kind of nice, but the fourth one is forced and the fifth will just turn your stomach. <br />
<br />
That is the same thing that happened to me with regards to Artemisia. It is a beautiful fragrance, but it is so sweet and mellow and unoffensive that very soon you will get really bored to death with it and crave for something sharp and strong, something pungent and something a little more daring.<br />
<br />
Of course I understand that there is always room on every woman's dressing table for one or two such fragrances as Artemisia and I don't regret buying it and just like the chocolate truffles I will soon be craving some more of it for a day or two.<br />
<br />
Artemisia in its own genre is truly a great fragrance. But I think I would go for something more contrasting and multidimensional if that were to be my only fragrance for a while or my signature fragrance. <br />
<br />
The longevity is quite good, but sillage is really modest and it just hovers around your skin. Especially in the later stages people would think that you smell really good, but they might not notice that you are wearing a fragrance. I would not wear this in warmer months due to its creaminess and sweetness. It is great for fall and winter. I also think it is a great scent to wear at work since it is so pleasant and  unoffensive, but on a night out or a dress-up occasion I would go for something more theatrical and daring than little sweet Artemisia. But at nighttime when you want to relax and cozy up in bed it is a wonderful scent to wear.
